newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa all-shares, industrials at new highs.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa all-shares, industrials at new highs.

text.p: South African industrial and all-share indices finished at record highs in heavy volumes on Friday on continued positive sentiment, but the gold index tumbled to its lowest since March, 1993.
Dealers said hopes of an early interest rate cut and the easing of foreign exchange controls spurred the market to a firm finish albeit not as exciting as Thursday.
Gold shares were under the yoke of an ailing bullion price which pushed them below 1,000 for the first time in more than four years.

The overall index finished up 8.5 points to a fourth consecutive high of 7,411.2 points, the industrial index gained 5.3 points to a second consecutive high of 8,747.6. The gold index ended down 13.6 points to 994.8 points.
